title: The Observer API
desc: The web-native, JavaScript reactivity API for observing and intercepting JavaScript objects and arrays, and achieving the reactive everything!

features.title: The Reactive Everything
features.desc: True reactivity with even plain objects {}; no special classes or object wrappers!
features.desc-ideas: No re-defining and messing around object properties; no wrapping and messing around object identity; that leave your code unnatural. This is utility-first/based not wrapper/encapsulation/observable-based.
features.desc-ideas2: No object re-writing or encapsulation trick; everything kicks even with object literals: Observer.observe({}, callback);. adds observable capabilities to existing data structures like objects, arrays and class instances

features.title: Deeeep-Tree Bangs
features.desc: Observe deep object-tree operations! Optionally specify paths and even depths.

features.title: Web-Native
features.desc: No framework tie-up! Enjoy an architectural cousinship with native JavaScript!
features.desc-ideas: No framework cousinship! Get away with reactive development even in vanilla JavaScript!
features.desc-ideas2: No framework affiliations, cousinship, sistership, brothership, tie-up! | Equal-opportunity...

features.title: For Ambitions
features.desc: A feather-weight, low-level API for designing higher-level APIs and the next reactivity magic!
features.desc-ideas: We either want to highlight: its low-level APIship, synchronousity, transparent functional reactive programming, lightweight and barebones
features.desc-ideas2: None of the cost of trying to usecases/featureset. Usecase-specific - gives you the primitves to build your own. Extend it to derive your own
